2019-06-30T15:01:04Z: So, after all that excitement, here's the report. We hope you enjoyed that - crisis? What crisis? Austrian GP: Verstappen defeats Leclerc after remarkable recoveryRed Bull driver Max Verstappen passed Charles Leclerc in a thrilling finish to the Austrian Grand Prix to give Honda its first win since returning to Formula 1
2019-06-30T14:49:49Z: One of Honda's representative collects the constructors' trophy, in deference to their relationship with Red Bull.
2019-06-30T14:47:06Z: First win for Honda too since Button in 2006, although the conditions have been significantly more favourable than they were on that rainy ol' day in Hungary.
2019-06-30T14:45:02Z: You could cut the pre-podium atmosphere with a bit of broken front-wing endplate. Not much conversation going on...
2019-06-30T14:39:50Z: That's Giovinazzi's first F1 point, better late than never! Also, it's the first time an Italian driver has scored an F1 point since Liuzzi in 2010.
2019-06-30T14:37:57Z: PHWOAR! What an absolute corker of a race. Norris, Gasly, Sainz, Raikkonen and Giovinazzi complete the top 10.
2019-06-30T14:37:06Z: Guess what? This seemed inevitable. The incident between Leclerc and Verstappen is under investigation.
2019-06-30T14:36:21Z: Leclerc crosses the line 2.7s behind Verstappen, with Bottas third, Vettel fourth and Hamilton fifth.
2019-06-30T14:35:43Z: Verstappen strokes the Red Bull home through the final few corners well clear of Leclerc, and crosses the line to take a brilliant Austrian Grand Prix victory!
2019-06-30T14:35:07Z: What a statement this is. Hamilton and Vettel resigned to battling over fourth and fifth, as Verstappen and Leclerc take centre stage. We're in good hands.
2019-06-30T14:34:32Z: Away from all that excitement, Vettel has just passed Hamilton to reclaim fourth with a lap to spare.
2019-06-30T14:33:22Z: No complaints about the racing this weekend; this has been a classic.
2019-06-30T14:32:53Z: He's done it! Verstappen goes for it into Turn 3 this time, and makes sure there's no chance for Leclerc to come back by showing the Ferrari out wide exiting the corner!
2019-06-30T14:31:53Z: Leclerc has a look for the lead at Turn 3 and gets ahead of the Ferrari, but Leclerc gets better drive off the corner and, despite having DRS, can't make the move stick on the run to Turn 4!
2019-06-30T14:30:47Z: The Red Bull gets mighty close into Turn 3 but Leclerc holds position in the middle of the road, then hangs onto the place at Turn 4.
2019-06-30T14:30:14Z: Both cars clear Gasly, and Verstappen starts lap 67 with DRS against Leclerc into Turn 1.
2019-06-30T14:29:24Z: The gap between Leclerc and Verstappen is less than a second for the first time on lap 66.
2019-06-30T14:28:12Z: Last time round, Verstappen was nine tenths faster than the Ferrari.
2019-06-30T14:27:39Z: Verstappen is still getting the breaks in this traffic and is 1.7s behind Leclerc now. Six laps to go.
2019-06-30T14:26:53Z: Now then. The next car for Leclerc to lap is... the Red Bull of Gasly. How difficult is the Frenchman going to make life for the Ferrari driver?
2019-06-30T14:26:49Z: Magnussen locks up as Leclerc laps him, probably a very nervy moment there...
2019-06-30T14:26:03Z: Verstappen has a much easier time lapping Sainz and remains 2.8s behind Leclerc.
2019-06-30T14:25:46Z: Gasly's challenge on Norris has somewhat abated, having fallen 2.2s behind - as Sainz loses a second letting Leclerc through.
2019-06-30T14:25:34Z: Red Bull isn't wrong. Leclerc has a rough lap in traffic and loses around eight tenths to Verstappen on that lap - so there's now less than three seconds between the leaders.
2019-06-30T14:23:22Z: Another new fastest lap from Verstappen, who sets a 1m07.475s. He's just four seconds behind Leclerc now!
2019-06-30T14:22:23Z: ...never mind, Giovinazzi's let Verstappen through and has tumbled off the back of Raikkonen.
2019-06-30T14:21:46Z: The two Alfas are line astern, with Giovinazzi really giving it everything to pass Raikkonen.
2019-06-30T14:21:33Z: Leclerc gets below the 1m08s mark for the first time, but Verstappen goes even quicker and sets a new fastest lap of the race. He's 4.8s behind the race leader, and is told to go to engine mode 11.
2019-06-30T14:21:15Z: Sainz has shaved a second off of the Gasly gap, and he's coming to help Norris out with the Frenchman.
2019-06-30T14:20:38Z: Vettel hasn't set the world alight with on his softs, and is still 4.5s behind Hamilton right now.
2019-06-30T14:19:52Z: Leclerc responds with a new personal best on his most recent lap. a 1m08.225s takes his advantage over Verstappen back above five seconds.
2019-06-30T14:18:50Z: Game well and truly on. Verstappen is 4.9s behind Leclerc with 15 laps to go.
2019-06-30T14:18:18Z: We don't know what he's complaining about. Verstappen dives past Bottas into Turn 3 - timing it perfectly, as he has all afternoon, to pick up DRS exiting the corner too - and is up to second!
2019-06-30T14:17:13Z: Verstappen reports in a rather alarming tone that he's losing power. He's right with Bottas still, though.
2019-06-30T14:17:08Z: And Raikkonen's fallen to the overtures of Sainz, who now scoops up P8. Next up, Gasly - just the small matter of a 5.5s gap to overturn.
2019-06-30T14:15:55Z: Vettel sets a 1m07.787s new fastest lap, and is 6.3s behind Hamilton at the moment.
2019-06-30T14:15:28Z: Bottas set a new personal best on the previous lap, but it still wasn't enough to extend his gap back to Verstappen, who is now within a second of the Mercedes.
2019-06-30T14:15:00Z: Raikkonen's just over a second up the road from Sainz now. What a stellar drive, who even needs qualifying?
2019-06-30T14:13:53Z: Sainz continues his mission, and is now up to ninth after passing Perez and subsequently Giovinazzi.
2019-06-30T14:13:46Z: No let up from Verstappen, who's now just over a second behind second-place man Bottas.
2019-06-30T14:12:59Z: Verstappen set a new fastest time of 1m07.844s on that lap too! Vettel decides to bail for plan B after all that, and stops for a new set of softs with 20 laps to go.
2019-06-30T14:12:04Z: It was just a matter of time! Verstappen's exit off Turn 3 is even better and, although Vettel opts for the inside line early, the Red Bull has more grunt on the run to Turn 4 and takes third. Verstappen's grandstand erupts.
2019-06-30T14:10:34Z: Vettel is a lot scruffier than Verstappen at Turn 3 this time and Verstappen has another sniff on the run to Turn 4, but still the Ferrari remains third. A matter of time?
2019-06-30T14:09:36Z: Sainz is doing a stunning job, passing Stroll and Hulkenberg - and he's just 0.8s behind Perez in tenth.
2019-06-30T14:09:21Z: Verstappen got close into Turn 3, and even closer into Turn 4 and out of the corner, but remains fourth for now.
2019-06-30T14:09:01Z: Ricciardo pits from eighth, ditching his spent mediums and rejoining in 14th.
2019-06-30T14:08:49Z: It was just one backmarker, actually. Vettel and Verstappen clear Kubica before Turn 9, and Verstappen is right behind the Ferrari at Turn 1!
2019-06-30T14:06:31Z: Verstappen is firmly in the same shot as Vettel now, but agonisingly outside of DRS range.
2019-06-30T14:06:04Z: McLaren asks Norris to help Ricciardo with DRS, aiming not to let Gasly through. Then, on cue, Gasly passes the Renault driver. Worth a try, though?
2019-06-30T14:05:36Z: Leading gaps at the start of lap 45: 1 Leclerc; 2 Bottas +3.8s; 3 Vettel +6.8s; 4 Verstappen +7.9s; 5 Hamilton +20s
2019-06-30T14:05:08Z: Sainz pinched fastest lap on his new hards, but Verstappen takes it back with a 1m08.165s. He's perilously close to being within DRS range of Vettel.
2019-06-30T14:03:43Z: New fastest lap from Verstappen, who sets a 1m08.317s and is less than two second behind Vettel with 27 laps remaining.
2019-06-30T14:03:20Z: Sainz pits from sixth, emerging in 14th place thanks to the generous gap between Stroll and Albon.
2019-06-30T14:02:37Z: Norris finally squeaks past Ricciardo, taking seventh. Gasly's next up to try and pass the Australian.
2019-06-30T14:00:49Z: Hamilton, by contrast, is nine seconds behind the Red Bull in a pretty lonely fifth.
2019-06-30T14:00:04Z: Verstappen is the real mover at the moment. He's fastest among the five leaders and just 2.4s behind Vettel now.
2019-06-30T13:59:58Z: Ricciardo's backing Norris into the clutches of Gasly, a situation that McLaren would definitely not want. Solid defending from the Renault driver, if not futile.
2019-06-30T13:58:14Z: Norris is very close to the yet-to-stop Ricciardo, but can't seem to get a run on him on this lap.
2019-06-30T13:55:40Z: Leclerc takes fastest lap back from Vettel with a 1m08.344s.
2019-06-30T13:53:35Z: Interesting strategy for Norris here; starting on softs, he's decided to go for the yellow-walled mediums for the rest of this race.
2019-06-30T13:52:04Z: Gasly has finally swashbuckled his way past Raikkonen, lifting himself up into P9.
2019-06-30T13:51:12Z: Sainz, currently P6, is logging some very nice times on some worn mediums, remaining in the 1m09s. He'd rejoin behind Grosjean if he stopped now, but the Haas driver is also yet to pit.
2019-06-30T13:51:10Z: So, leading gaps after 32 laps: 1 Leclerc; 2 Bottas +4s; 3 Vettel +9.3s; 4 Verstappen +12.8s; 5 Hamilton +17.9s
2019-06-30T13:50:19Z: Smart work from Red Bull, too, which hauls Verstappen in for a stop and gets him back out four seconds ahead of Hamilton.
2019-06-30T13:49:42Z: That wing change costs Hamilton dearly. He's some eight seconds down on Vettel now, who is a net third and has just set another fastest lap.
2019-06-30T13:48:06Z: Mercedes mechanics out in the pitlane with a new front wing for Hamilton.
2019-06-30T13:47:54Z: Perez comes into pit, rejoining behind Giovinazzi.
2019-06-30T13:46:54Z: Verstappen is within six seconds of Hamilton now, with Leclerc 7.2s further back.
2019-06-30T13:46:00Z: Hamilton reports he's clipped his wing somewhere, and thinks he might have lost some downforce.
2019-06-30T13:45:14Z: ONe of F1's funky graphics say there's currently a 25% chance of Hamilton overtaking team-mate Bottas when he stops.
2019-06-30T13:45:11Z: Giovinazzi seems to have reeled in Gasly too, as the two presumably miss their GP2 sparring days.
2019-06-30T13:43:57Z: Norris, Gasly and Stroll all make stops, but Gasly still can't rejoin ahead of Raikkonen.
2019-06-30T13:42:20Z: Hamilton's lead over Verstappen is 7.630s. The Mercedes man also has the fastest lap of all now - a 1m08.842s.
2019-06-30T13:41:20Z: ...but that's moot, as Raikkonen makes his pitstop.
2019-06-30T13:40:59Z: Gasly's been dispatched by Vettel already, and the Ferrari driver has to repass Raikkonen to recover from that pitstop.
2019-06-30T13:40:12Z: Replays show it was the front-left that Ferrari was particularly slow with. Vettel is seventh now, behind Raikkonen and Norris again.
2019-06-30T13:39:33Z: Leclerc is in next time by and also takes hards, which he'll likely run to the finish.
2019-06-30T13:39:08Z: Bottas is in and out in decent time, but it looks as though Ferrari responded to that and made a late call to pit; he was stopped for 6.1s! Both are back out on hards.
2019-06-30T13:38:47Z: Raikkonen's defense of seventh place is impassioned, and is keeping Gasly at bay quite adeptly.
2019-06-30T13:38:12Z: Bottas - on mediums - and Vettel - on softs - head for the pits.
2019-06-30T13:37:57Z: Kubica pits from P19, emerging on hard tyres in...P19.
2019-06-30T13:35:49Z: The Ferraris are flying. Leclerc briefly sets the fastest lap, only to have it taken away by Vettel, who sets a 1m09.073s. He's now within three seconds of Hamilton.
2019-06-30T13:35:38Z: Gasly and Raikkonen going hammer and tongs into turn 4, but the Alfa driver holds onto seventh place.
2019-06-30T13:33:38Z: Raikkonen hasn't given up on taking back sixth, he's within DRS range of Norris and he's bringing Gasly with him.
2019-06-30T13:33:06Z: Verstappen pumps in the fastest lap of all now - a 1m09.252s. He's 4.5s behind Vettel, who is now 3.5s behind Hamilton.
2019-06-30T13:30:52Z: Norris chucks it past Raikkonen for sixth, sternly making a move at Turn 3. Good stuff.
2019-06-30T13:29:54Z: Leclerc asks Ferrari to tell him when to start pushing. The team says his current pace is good.
2019-06-30T13:29:41Z: Magnussen's got a drive-through penalty for not parking up at his grid slot properly. Disaster.
2019-06-30T13:28:51Z: Norris is reeling in Raikkonen, aiming to recover sixth from the Finnish veteran.
2019-06-30T13:27:56Z: The action at the rear of the midfield continues; Albon grabs P15 from Magnussen, who comes into the pits, while Grosjean fends off the hustling Russell and Kvyat.
2019-06-30T13:27:16Z: Leclerc;s lead is a decent, albeit stable, 3.5s over Bottas right now. Hamilton's 6.4s further back in third, and four seconds ahead of Vettel.
2019-06-30T13:25:46Z: Russell's right in this mix too, looking to pick up the pieces of this Albon/Grosjean battle.
2019-06-30T13:25:24Z: Sainz clears Magnussen, as Grosjean is shuffled out of the way by Alex Albon.
2019-06-30T13:23:50Z: Verstappen perfects the move into Turn 3 once again and is clear of Raikkonen for fifth now.
2019-06-30T13:22:55Z: Better news for Verstappen now though, as he's picked off Norris into Turn 3. That's sixth for the Red Bull now, as he sets after Raikkonen - who has been passed by Vettel.
2019-06-30T13:21:26Z: Replay show anti-stall kicking in on Verstappen's car at the start, hence his plummet through the top 10.
2019-06-30T13:19:58Z: Magnussen's slipped to P13, and despite an amazing qualifying session it just seems like the Haas team is struggling to switch on tyres again.
2019-06-30T13:19:49Z: Verstappen can't repeat Vettel's trick the following lap, though. He's not close enough into Turn 3, and even with a better tow into Turn 4 Norris holds position well into the corner.
2019-06-30T13:18:40Z: No nonsense from Vettel, who gets up the inside of Norris into Turn 3, appears to give the McLaren a little nudge and takes fifth. Norris has a go at retaliating with the help of DRS down to Turn 4, but Vettel's now a safe fifth and quickly hunting down Raikkonen.
2019-06-30T13:17:26Z: Sainz is kicking on, after starting at the back he's already up to P15.
2019-06-30T13:16:46Z: Perez, Hulkenberg, Stroll and Ricciardo all very close together - the pink and yellow combo coalescing into some kind of midfield marshmallow.
2019-06-30T13:16:30Z: Leclerc sets an early fastest lap of 1m09.282s and is two seconds clear of Bottas.
2019-06-30T13:15:40Z: Giovinazzi's dropped back behind Gasly, while Ricciardo and Grosjean are the other losers off the start.
2019-06-30T13:15:33Z: Order after lap one: 1 Leclerc; 2 Bottas; 3 Hamilton; 4 Raikkonen; 5 Norris; 6 Vettel; 7 Verstappen; 8 Gasly; 9 Giovinazzi; 10 Magnussen.
2019-06-30T13:14:58Z: Hamilton gets Norris, who is now passed by Raikkonen into Turn 4. They duel for a bit longer, but the position is Raikkonen's.
2019-06-30T13:14:05Z: Disaster for Verstappen, who gets an awful start and is swamped off the line! Leclerc holds his lead into the first corner, and leads from Bottas and Norris - who's wheel to wheel with Hamilton.
2019-06-30T13:13:16Z: The Austrian Grand Prix is underway!
2019-06-30T13:11:43Z: Here is the full run down of starting tyres:Leclerc - softVerstappen - mediumBottas - mediumHamilton - mediumNorris - softRaikkonen - softGiovinazzi - softGasly - softVettel - softMagnussen - softGrosjean - mediumRicciardo - mediumPerez - mediumStroll - mediumHulkenberg - mediumKvyat - mediumKubica - mediumAlbon - mediumSainz - mediumRussell - medium
2019-06-30T13:10:42Z: Almost time to go! Please, viewers at home, make sure you've got a nice cold drink - if it's anywhere near as hot as it is in Austria, stay hydrated.
2019-06-30T13:08:30Z: There's five different teams in the top six, which is a pretty tasty prospect for this race.
2019-06-30T13:05:58Z: Those gazebos go to show that the F1 grid is an incredibly in-tents environment...
2019-06-30T13:03:40Z: We believe that the Leclerc/Verstappen front row is F1's youngest ever. Both are 21.
2019-06-30T13:00:33Z: It's so hot that teams have employed a gazebo strategy for the grid to keep everything cool. The Glastonbury festival organisers banned gazebos for this year, so presumably they've all turned up to the Red Bull Ring.
